Hey Alex! I am Bulby.
Hi Bulby!
Do you know we can save a lot on our electricity bill with just a few small changes?
I would love to save some money and energy Bulby. Tell me how!
Have you ever heard about peak hours? We can save big if we avoid doing household chores during these times.
Really? When are these peak hours?
Usually around 7pm. That is when everyone is home using lots of electricity for cooking heating and entertainment.
So what can we do to save energy?
One simple trick is to shift our energy-intensive chores to off-peak times like late at night or early in the morning.
How does that help Bulby?
During off-peak times fewer people use electricity so the demand is lower. This often means the cost of electricity is cheaper and it puts less strain on the power grid.
That sounds great! Any other tips?
Oh there are plenty! But first take a look at the tasks ahead. Some are so obvious yet we often overlook them. I believe you can make the right decisions.
I will definitely start paying more attention to when and how I use our appliances. Thanks for the tip Bulby!
No problem! Every little bit helps. Good luck!

Ensure the door seals are tight and make sure that the fridge is not overcrowded.
Leave the refrigerator door open to allow for better air circulation.
Keep the refrigerator at its highest temperature setting to save energy.
